attributes.action: Increase the amount of money that a person signed off work on sick pay receives.
attributes.background: I'm currently receiving sick pay of £360 a month, due to being hit by a car off my motorcycle by a car driver resulting in breaking my shoulder. The £360 a month that i receive soon disappears due to bills and it's very hard to live off of this amount of money a month, when i physically cannot work.
attributes.additional_details: I'm creating this petition to help others in my situation, who physically cannot work due to a motor vehicle accident. Crashes, accidents and injuries sometimes cannot be helped, if you've been injured from the same case to mine or one similar, why should the injured party suffer due to carelessness of another person? It's certainly not fair that the injured party has to live off of £360 a month when the other person can go back to work and earn their standard living wages a month.

attributes.action: Televise Government lobby briefings
attributes.background: With trust in both politicians and the mainstream media at an all time low,  government lobby briefings should be televised to demonstrate a true record of what has taken place.
attributes.additional_details: The public are sceptical that lobby briefings as reported are a true reflection of the exchanges, as can be seen from the White House press briefings, what is said is available for anyone to view impartially without media bias.

attributes.action: Offset any rise in the price of fuel
attributes.background: As Christmas is approaching, I would like to propose that if the price of a litre of fuel is to rise by 3p then the government should reduce the amount of tax on fuel by the very same amount. As a result, motorists will not be impacted by any fuel cost rises.

attributes.action: I want a Royal Commision to examine the Obesity Crisis in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: UK obesity dates from the almost total collapse of the once World leading UK pottery industry in Stoke on Trent. A typical plate increased from 9.5 inches to 11 inches dia. That holds 40% more nosh & we led a much more active life; no Ipads and stuff then!

attributes.action: Make the Tax-Free Childcare service more transparent for Childcare Providers
attributes.background: There is a complete lack of communication about payments that have been made through Tax-Free Childcare. Providers have an account they can login to, but cannot see any payments that have been made to them.
attributes.additional_details: We rely on parents telling us they have made a payment, and then have to wait until the money is credited to our bank account which can take several working days. We do not get any notification about when a payment is made, and if we call the helpline we are told that information cannot be shared about any pending payments due to data protection. Even on our bank statements, it does not say who the payment has come from. We cannot operate a business like this.

attributes.action: Stop councils having to pay when planning decisions are overturned on appeal
attributes.background: Having spoken to local councillors it would appear the councils are becoming unwilling to deny planning because of the costs involved if overturned at appeal. This needs to stop or will end up with councils unwilling to do their best for the people, purely based on money.
attributes.additional_details: I feel the need to ask this question having been witness to the completely inappropriate and ill advised project to double the size of a small village in North Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Create a devolved parliament for the county of Devon
attributes.background: Devon has for too long been put at the bottom of the agenda by the out-of-touch Government in Westminster. We have received far too little in the way of funding for education and the NHS. A devolved assembly would allow us to decide on issues like tax, agriculture housing and education.
attributes.additional_details: The Government at Westminster has for too long now shown a complete lack of regard for The South West and Devon in particular. And despite promises, our hospitals, schools and infrastructure has been underfunded and it is making the people of Devon frustrated. Our pupils are underfunded, local hospitals are being forced to close and our railway system is dreadful, with projects planned before WWII that still haven't been completed. We want a more prosperous Devon inside a fairer united Kingdom.

attributes.action: All England, Scotland and Wales national team games available on freeview TV
attributes.background: I am English and I want to see my national team play.  I follow Rugby Union but I am unable to see live coverage of England games during the Rugby Union autumn international tests because I have to subscribe to SKY.

attributes.action: Council Right To Build
attributes.background: We are calling upon the Government to grant Local Authorities the right to build and the right to buy so that housing can be let to families on low incomes at social housing rents. If the Government target of building 300,000 new homes is to be achieved, councils will have to play their part.
attributes.additional_details:
Local Authority resources are stretched to breaking point. This government has acknowledged our widespread housing crisis, but still the wait goes on for tangible action to get housebuilders building genuinely affordable homes.

The last time that 300,000 homes were built in one year in England was in 1969, when councils and housing associations were also building new homes. The private sector has never and does not have the inclination to reach these numbers.

attributes.action: Ensure Cricket Test Matches played by England are on Terrestrial TV.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State should amend the Group B list of events to include Cricket Test Matches played by England, instead of “in England”.
attributes.additional_details: It always used to be the case that sporting events of national significance had to be shown in some form (live or substantial highlights) on terrestrial television. For the first time BT has a monopoly on both live and highlight packages of the Ashes.

attributes.action: Negotiate a deal to keep the UK in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to specifically negotiate the UKs future relationship to the Digital Single Market in the final Brexit deal.  Ignoring the digital economy would put the UK’s future prosperity and thousands of jobs unnecessarily at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
The digital economy is borderless yet depends on consumer trust and business confidence. Leaving the Digital Single Market will tax that confidence in more ways than one. We ask the HM Government to start being responsible for publicly addressing:
(1) future relations to EU agencies such as ENISA and EDPB 
(2) participation in EU funded research 
(3) regulatory alignment to EU rules for telecoms (incl. free roaming), data protection, consumer rights, audio visual media services, and copyright.

attributes.action: Prohibit operating tractors & other agricultural vehicles between 07:30 - 09:00
attributes.background: A tailback of cars stretching miles behind a tractor during rush hour in the morning is a sight many of the British public are accustomed to. Their use not only causes huge delays to travel times but puts other drivers at risk of incident as a result of forced manoeuvre.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have experienced considerable delays due to these vehicles, whose operation at peak rush hour is generally dispensible and subservient at these hours. Tractors also breed anger into the drivers who are stuck behind them, with no hope of manoeuvring unless subjecting themselves to an incident. The difference in time between agricultural vehicles travelling at 8am rather than 9am is negligible and should be considered when contemplating this petition.

attributes.action: To withdraw the invitation extended to Donald Trump of a state visit to the UK
attributes.background: In light of the current US administration's withdrawal from the JCPOA the appropriateness of a UK state visit must be reassessed. The actions of Donald Trump threaten both global security and to undermine global cooperation on all fronts. A state visit sends a message of solidarity not condemnation.

attributes.action: Raise Awarness for Morgellons Disease and co infections eg: Lymes Disease
attributes.background: I was bitten by a tick in the uk in 2011 I didn’t seek treatment as I didn’t no the risks. I was very ill over a number of years losing my hair etc. It was only when fibres started to come from my skin that I was diagnosed with Morgellons Disease a chronic form of Lymes Disease caused by the tick
attributes.additional_details: I am now under treatment but can’t be cured. Yet this Disease is still not recognised as a genuine illness as over the years patients have been dismissed as being dillusional. I am under a Dermatologist at the Royal London Hospital. Who states this is not a dillusion! The Disease needs listing on the rare disease register

attributes.action: Automatic British Citizenship for Indefinite Leave to Remainers settled 15 years
attributes.background: My parents immigrated to the UK with my sister and I in 1988. I obtained ILR status in 2001 having lived in the U.K. since aged 2, gone to university and worked here all my life. It’s not fair to have to sit a test and pay £1330 to become Naturalised. Britain has been my home all my life.
attributes.additional_details: I am 31 years old. I have lived in the U.K. for 29 years.  I have had ILR status since 2001 (for 17 years). It is not fair to have to sit a life in the UK test and pay £1330 to become naturalised. I’ve gone to nursery, primary school, secondary school and  University and spent my whole working life in the U.K. The Government even recognise my 9 month old daughter as British so why do I have to pay over the odds when I pay tax and national insurance and have done my whole working life!

attributes.action: Require all toll bridges to treat disabled people equally
attributes.background: The Government must require parity for all disabled people to use toll bridges and roads for free, not just those on Disability Living Allowance. For example, I’m disabled but too old to qualify for disability living allowance which means I can’t use the Dartford river crossing for free.
attributes.additional_details: As a blue badge holder I can go through London without paying the congestion charge surely it should be the same using the Dartford river crossing. This is free for people who receive Disability Living Allowance and has an exemption from paying vehicle tax as a result. However anyone in my position is still required to pay due to being too old to apply for Disability Living Allowance.

attributes.action: Have the A1 & A2 Motorcycle Licence automatically upgrade after 2 years
attributes.background:
Upgrade the A1 to a A2 after 2 years. 
Upgrade the A2 to a full licence after 2 years. 
Car drivers can drive a vehicle with any power after one test, why can't us bikers? 
At least with 2 years experience of each licence, surely that is enough experience to be given the privilege to move up.
attributes.additional_details: Bikers must complete a CBT test for a 125. Then another test for the A1 licence, that is for a 125 again. It consists of a theory test, a module 1 and a module 2. Then bikers have to wait to be older anyway to go for the A2 licence that again consists of a module 1 & a module 2 , then for the full A licence they must do another module 1 and module 2 test. To prepare for the tests, training is needed consisting at least 5 lessons costing a bomb and taking up alot your time. It's over kill.

attributes.action: Extend the remit of Employment Tribunals to include all equality-related cases
attributes.background: Employment Tribunals should become Employment & Equality Tribunals and hear all equality-related cases. Why have an Equality Act if only employees have access to legal redress? The Government must ensure that everyone, including pensioners and students, has equal access to justice at equal cost.
attributes.additional_details: The additional burden on the tribunal system would be small compared with the huge difference the change would make to those suffering breaches of the law. If the government won't extend the remit, they must explain why disabled students have fewer rights than disabled employees. An employee with a discrimination claim can go to the tribunal, but if someone other than their employer discriminates against them, they have to file an expensive claim in the County Court or the High Court.

attributes.action: Make the Department for Education invest £1.3 billion pounds in schools
attributes.background:
I am a student and the reason why I started this petition is because the education budget cuts had a devastating effect on my school and other schools in London.

If you sign this petition you are supporting my plea to make the government invest £1.3 billion pounds in schools.
attributes.additional_details: If you sign this petition you are supporting my plea to make the government to invest £1.3billion pounds in schools

attributes.action: Write all laws in Plain English
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that in order for the majority of the people to fully participate in the governance of the country, our laws should be written in a language that the people can readily understand.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that the current practice of drafting and presenting laws in Legal English and “Legalese” is detrimental to a truly representative Parliament and the involvement of the people in the government of the country.

We therefore demand that all future laws made in the UK Parliament should be written in Plain English.

attributes.action: Add Lichen sclerosus to the Medical Exemption list
attributes.background: To obtain a Medical Exemption Certificate and get free NHS prescriptions a condition needs to be on the current Medical Exemption list. I feel this list does not go far enough to help those suffering with long-term conditions such as Lichen Sclerosus. A revision could help thousands of people.

attributes.action: If you are an English citizen, you should not have to pay to attend university.
attributes.background: In Scotland, you do not have to pay to attend university, however, English citizens have to pay extortionate amounts just to get education. Without this education, many young people will not get the chances that their futures' deserve. You can change all this with just a vote.

attributes.action: Working people should be awarded 100% of the non working partners tax allowance
attributes.background: Every UK citizen is intitled to tax free income of 11500 pa. The fact that in a family unit only one person may be in full time employment while the other person may be at home bringing up children is not a good reason to financially penalise that family or any other in a similar position.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Introduce Emotional Assistance Pet Act to prevent suicides and help families!
attributes.background:
The legislation that allows the emotional support animal access in housing facilities, even when the complex has a no pet policy already exists in the US. So literally we are not discovering an America here.
The petition is simply a trigger for Parliament to introduce it into the UK legislation.
attributes.additional_details:
It is known that the highest rates of suicide are associated with depressive disorders. 

The human-animal emotional bond does not differ from the one that we sustain in relation to close family members i.e. our own children.

There is also Article 8 of the Human Rights Act that provides the right to respect for one’s established family life (no pre-determined model of a family or family life)

Being cut off from your pet (family member) is increasing the risk of depression.
http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: Introduce LGBT+ education to the primary curriculum in schools
attributes.background:
One of the reasons homophobia is still widespread is due to lack of education and understanding. To reverse this, and create a more accepting and less hating society for the future I want to petition for children to be educated.
Just as racism, sexism and other issues ARE issues, this is a HUGE one
attributes.additional_details:
Homophobia - the act of hatred from minor to extreme levels towards people who prefer the same gender
Impacts -
more hate crimes, tragedies, killings and more, just for something someone cant change and which is not abnormal, a "sin" or any other sort
Evidence -
You dont need me to state. Recall some memories when you were a child.Look at the messed up world.Look at the different LGBT rights in areas. Not many places have equal rights yet at ALL.
Speak up and SIGN this petition for EQUALITY

attributes.action: Abolish school uniform in all schools.
attributes.background: School uniform rules have recently become too strict, to the point where people are being suspended from school for their appearance. We preach about not missing education yet we stop it over cloth and dye? Teenagers should express themselves and not be punished for being unique.
attributes.additional_details: When a student has done something particularly bad like get into a fight or bully another student we suspend them or put them in isolation to punish the student. Why is a student with blue hair or with a t-shirt being punished at the same level? We encourage students to 'be themselves' yet we confine this with rules. Teenagers already struggle in schools with exams, hormones, sexuality etc. We shouldn't be giving them more reasons to stress out. Casual dress-code doesn't stop them learning.

attributes.action: Conduct rolling referenda so that the Brexit deal commands support AT THE TIME
attributes.background: Older voters, who were more likely to have died by the time 'Leave' takes effect, tended to favour 'Leave', whilst those under the age of 18, who will live much longer with the consequences, didn't get a vote at all.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is to conduct a potentially rolling sequence of referenda to ensure that the final outcome from the Brexit negotiations reflects the widest possible support AT THE TIME THE FINAL DEAL COMES INTO EFFECT.

There are 4 options. 1. Take the deal. 2. Re-negotiate 3. Stay in the EU 4. Leave with no agreement.

The voters rank the options in order of preference.

When one option commands more than 50 percent of the votes, or if the top option is 2, re-negotiate, that's what HMG will action.

Otherwise the option with the fewest votes is eliminated, and its supporters' votes are re-allocated to their next preferences.

If option 2, re-negotiate, wins, there would have to be a further referendum 3 months later, conducted as above.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.

attributes.action: Public enquiry into child sexual abuse and exportation in Cleveland
attributes.background: Cleveland police have investigated child sexual abuse and exploitation with little result. I believe many more people should have been charged and many people were too scared to come forward. The impact of this has devastated many people and even led to drug and alcohol problems.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and farming of non-free range eggs.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition as I feel it is wrong to farm eggs in factories then sell them as the eggs are not healthy but also the chicken who creates the eggs is tortured and pumped with chemicals and I feel this is wrong.

attributes.action: Let contraceptives be sold over-the-counter
attributes.background: Contraceptives are currently not sold over-the-counter, you have to get a prescription for one. I believe that this should change. Many people require contraceptive pills and other forms of contraception for different reasons, and they have to go through too much hassle. Make pills over the counter!
attributes.additional_details: People need contraceptives. Women and men - regardless of sexuality - need them to stop STIs and unplanned pregnancies. Transgender men who aren't on HRT can use them to stop their periods, and they may have a judgmental family who would treat them harshly if they found out this was why they were getting contraception - especially 13-to-16-year-olds. Making contraceptives over-the-counter will benefit so many people in terms of health and confidentiality, so what are we waiting for?

attributes.action: Create a scheme that encourages those receiving state benefits to litter pick
attributes.background: As we know from recent media attention, litter is blighting our country and wildlife, and the only way to clear it up is to pick it up. The scheme would not only do this, but also give participants a sense of achievement and responsibility, perhaps encouraged by a reward.
attributes.additional_details: Further consideration should be made for the armed forces, whilst not engaged in military action, to contribute manpower to the scheme.

attributes.action: Stop asking schools to check the right to work for parents on school visits
attributes.background: Parents accompanying off site visits with schools are classed as volunteers. All workers voluntary or otherwise must have their right to work checked. This requirement for checks involves schools taking a copy of a passport and signing and dating to say it represents the parent.
attributes.additional_details: I am Headteacher in a busy primary school and neither I nor my office staff have time for unnecessary work. This requirement to check adds an additional admin burden for people who in goodwill are supporting the work of the school on a casual and irregular basis. Accompanying off site visits does not constitute work and will not lead to employment. Parents of children who attend a state funded school must have the right to work and residence or their children will not get a place in school.

attributes.action: Ban positive action in organisations and have all candidates treated equally.
attributes.background: Positive action is unfair. For example, a wealthy female will have an advantage over a less affluent male when it comes to recruitment. No organisation should ask for race, religion, gender or sexuality. This is not relevant to the job and results in less effective recruitment UK wide.
attributes.additional_details: Companies and government organisations should be concerned with finding the best, regardless of non-relevant issues such as a persons sexuality. Employers should be blind when it comes to who gets through to assessment centres and interviews. It’s not fair that suddenly every white male is considered as having being born with a silver spoon. It’s also not fair to treat minorities and women as though they need an advantage in the recruitment process as they couldn’t get the job on their merit

attributes.action: End Child Maintenance for Shared care parents.
attributes.background: As it currently stands the resident parent can claim Child Maitanence from the other parent based on how many nights they stay with them. For example up to 57 nights per year is what the child maintanence service class as shared care but still the non resident parent has to pay maintanence.
attributes.additional_details: As an example I have a shared care arrangement with my daughters mum who has residency with them, they stay with me Wednesday - Saturday 7.30pm week 1 & Thursday - Saturday 7.30pm week 2. When they are with me they have everything they need E.g own school clothes, daily clothes, footwear Etc. Their mum claims child benefit & child tax credits for them and yet Child Maintanence Service (CMS) still claim I should still be paying more money to their mum. End the Equality for non resident parents!

attributes.action: Teach young adults the struggles of owning a house.
attributes.background: I would like for schools and colleges ect, to teach young adults how hard it is to run a property of their own so when it comes to them having their own property rented, bought or shared accommodation they will know what to do when they come to the hurdles without it ending in them becoming homeless
attributes.additional_details: I strongly agree something like this should be taught budgeting, mortgages. Too many people going into the world with no life skills.

attributes.action: Law requiring food chains to show the calories on menus.
attributes.background:
All food-service chains with 20 or more locations must post the number of calories in the food and drink items they sell.
This law should be implemented as it allows the public to count the amount of calories they eat. It can also reduce the chances of obesity.

attributes.action: Ban all advertising boards on the side of motorways.
attributes.background: Drivers are constantly being threatened with prosecution if they use mobile phones, smoke, vape or do anything that distracts them from driving. Motorway advertising is specifically designed to distract drivers. Some of them have animation and can be very bright by using neon type lighting.
attributes.additional_details: It is a central argument of the government that distractions such as mobile phones etc can affect the driving ability of road users. The same evidence and research can be used to argue that advertising boards have the same effect and are therefore dangerous.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who order goods that are out of stock at the time.
attributes.background: Consumers currently have the right to a refund if unhappy with goods purchased online. They should have the same right when purchasing goods in a shop where the goods are out of stock at time of purchase; as with an Internet purchase, the consumer can't inspect the goods until they actually arrive.
attributes.additional_details: In the face-to-face scenario, it can happen that the goods are out of stock, the trader asks for payment prior to ordering the goods into stock, the trader receives the goods into stock, the consumer inspects the goods but is unhappy with them, then the trader refuses to refund the consumer’s money, forcing the consumer to either accept the goods or alternatively a credit note that may be of no use to the consumer.  I believe that consumers should have the right to a refund in this situation.

attributes.action: Adopt unilateral free trade with the whole world.
attributes.background: We call upon the Government to adopt Unilateral Free Trade to reduce import costs to consumers and businesses. This means removing all tariffs on goods and services, reducing non-tariff trade barriers and recognising other countries' technical standards as equivalent unilaterally.
attributes.additional_details:
Unilateral free trade is the most pragmatic and fair trade policy for Britain. End discriminatory, mercantilist policies and embrace UFT to (1) lower input costs for businesses and the poorest consumers; (2) allow negotiators to focus on services agreements; (3) stimulate domestic competition; (4) reduce red-tape; and (6) lead by example to make the moral case for free trade. 

If you are unwilling to show leadership on trade issues, Britain's consumers are more than willing to do so.

attributes.action: The UK Government should provide financial aid solutions for future pilots
attributes.background: A major factor driving fewer people to take up the career is the cost of training. Aspiring pilots, who aren’t able to secure a place on the limited number of airline sponsored training schemes, need to find large sums of money to pay for their own training costs which can be upwards of £100,000.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.ft.com/content/d7117f1e-d963-11e5-a72f-1e7744c66818

http://www.fta-global.com/fta-news/pilot-shortage-looms-but-uk-and-european-commercial-pilot-licence-issues-are-down

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/av/business-42917181/pilot-shortage-who-s-going-to-fly-our-planes

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-11691204

http://www.travelweekly.co.uk/articles/35126/balpa-warns-of-uk-pilot-shortage

attributes.action: Redirect funds gained from taxing 'Legal Highs' to Safe Housing & Rehab Centres
attributes.background:
Formally Legal highs started out as a legal recreational drug, found in many shops in the UK and often seen in use in festivals. 
Fast forward 10 years and the now illegal  psychoactive substances leave addicts with side effects, paranoia, coma, seizures and death with no specialised support.
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the new legislation ( The Psychoactive Substances Act May 2016)  ' legal high' was the title given to  substances sold that emulated illegal drugs such as cocaine,heroin, speed, cannabis. It could be found sold in shops/festivals/online. Since the Ban was enforced these psychoactive drugs have been forced underground and are now even more dangerous. I suggest that any taxes gathered from the years that the drug was 'legal ' should be redirected in specific rehab and homeless centres.

attributes.action: Legal Protection for children under age of 16 sending images to sexual predators
attributes.background: Police are threatening to charge children for creating and disturbing child pornography when sending images of themselves to sexual predators thats grooming real children.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents are now not willing to report online child sexual exploitation crimes because of fears teens will be arrested. Currently only chikdren under the age of 13 is protected from Child porn crimes when images are off themselves. 

Why should our children face charges because someone groomed them into sending images.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: Change the British military's standard issue rifle to the C8/L119
attributes.background: The British military's current rifle, the SA80/L85, is completely outclassed by the Colt Canada C8SFW Carbine, with its higher stopping power and rate of fire, already in use by special forces, the Royal Military Police and Royal Marine 43 Commando Fleet Protection Group
attributes.additional_details: Already a proven rifle, the swap would increase the effectiveness of a single infantry soldier in a firefight. The similarities to the US M4 would also allow spare parts to be used between us and our most powerful ally, and allow soldiers to pick up each other's weapons, for whatever reason, and already be used to an extremely similar one.

attributes.action: Increase the number of GCSE options that schools offer
attributes.background: The choices we have for GCSE's can be very limited within schools. In my GCSE choices I only had nine other options, other than the core few. This has limited my possible learning and perhaps my future.
attributes.additional_details: The choices you have limit what is possible in the future for me and others with limited choices.

attributes.action: Make rehabilitation the main aim of a Judge when sentencing criminals.
attributes.background: In the UK, the main aim of Judges while sentencing is a mix of rehabilitation and deterrence, however, I believe that by deciding on one main aim, we could reduce reoffending rates.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.businessinsider.com/why-norways-prison-system-is-so-successful-2014-12?international=true&r=US&IR=T 

The link above will take you to a trusted news website. The selected page is all about how the rehabilitation rates in Switzerland are lower than in America, Therefore, proving our point.

attributes.action: Reverse central government funding cuts to councils
attributes.background: Since 2010 central government has cut the funding to councils. It is planned that by 2020 funding by central government to councils will be reduced by 77%. Causing councils to have to make MORE devastating cuts to much needed services including social care, childrens services, education, and more.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the austerity cuts councils have had to make savings, and that has led to a spiraling funding problem, causing the most vulnerable to suffer, social services at crisis point, our roads in dire need of need repair and our children services and early years cut and cut again causing generational damage. It is time to realise that the decision of 2010 by Conservative/Lib Dem government is causing untold damage to the UK, and it needs to be reversed. Put the funding back into our councils.

attributes.action: Ban gas stunning of animals
attributes.background: Gas stunning is a cruel method of killing animals. A video on YouTube made me aware of this horrid way animals are killed everyday. It should be made illegal.
